triple.translation[0].definitions[0].def: having three parts or involving three groups, people, events etc
triple.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a triple bill of horror movies
triple.translation[0].definitions[1].def: three times more than a particular number
triple.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The rail system has triple the average number of accidents.
triple.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this
triple.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The company has tripled in size.
We expect to triple our profits next year.
triple.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a hit of the ball in baseball that allows the batter to get to the third base
triple.translation[2].definitions[1].def: three turns of your body in a sport such as ice skating or gymnastics
triple.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Music sales saw triple-digit growth in the last financial year.
a triple alliance of the government, state industries and foreign firms
triple.translation[4].definitions[0].def: to become three times as much or as many, or to make something do this
triple.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: The newspaper tripled its circulation in less than a year.
